strings.Value: "I was looking for you. I need your help in the capital."
{n}Shaking off his false image, Vordakai towers above even the other cyclopes that surround him. As you approach, he casually gestures toward you.{/n} "{name}. Why are you here?"
{n}Vordakai brushes drops of blood from his garment.{/n} "The final line has been drawn. I am ready to return to your city. It's time to get rid of those who claimed my... your land."

{n}The lich turns his head, and you can feel the gaze of his empty socket looking right through you.{/n} "An invasion from another world, isn't it? I've heard about this before, but have never seen it personally. I still need this world, so I will help you deal with this trouble."
{n}Vordakai turns his head toward the river.{/n} "But only after you help me. I want to make mincemeat of this sad excuse for a baron whose {d|c31 Vordakai Hired}image{/d} I assume at your court."
{n}The skin on Vordakai's face tightens, as though he's trying to sneer, but his features remain still.{/n} "I'm completing what I started on the day of my awakening."

"When the turmoil began, I went away â€” where once the cities of my people were towering. Where a great empire will one day be restored. Where there is no place for a nest of thieves and bandits. I summoned ancient warriors and lay siege on {g|Varnhold}Varnhold{/g}. All that is left is to break the fort's defense."

"This nobody, {d|Varn}Maegar Varn{/d} and his henchmen. Or rather, not they but fakes born by strange magic who consider themselves true mortals. Doesn't matter, I will destroy all of them, once and for all."
"Let's go, my servants! Trample our enemies!"
